Hi Jatin,

Thanks for sending the DNS records.
We have updated the records on your behalf.

Let me know if this works for you?

Hello,

I will go with cloudflare

But I need to check some DNS records and if not exist can you create it for me please

Can you please add following DNS records if not exist

1. SPF Record


  • Type: TXT



  • Name: @ (or duracube.com.au )



  • Content: v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com ~all



  • TTL: Auto or 3600




2. DKIM Record


  • Type: TXT



  • Name: google._domainkey



  • Content: v=DKIM1; k=rsa; 



  • TTL: Auto or 3600




3. DMARC Record


  • Type: TXT



  • Name: _dmarc



  • Content: v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc-reports@duracube.com.au



  • TTL: Auto or 3600




Kind Regards,

Jatin Vamja
Inventory Manager





13 Pullman Place, Emu Plains NSW 2750



0490 934 885



DuraCube



DuraCube

Hi Jatin,

I hope you’re doing well, just jumping in here.

Thanks for clarifying the situation. Since VentraIP requires the nameservers to be switched before any DNS records can be added, there are really two ways forward:

Option 1 — Stay on Cloudflare (No Downtime)
  • Keep the nameservers pointed to Cloudflare.
  • Manage all DNS records directly inside Cloudflare.
  • This avoids any downtime and keeps everything working as is.
  • You can still move to VentraIP later if needed, but it isn’t essential if you’re happy to continue with Cloudflare.

Option 2 — Move Nameservers to VentraIP (Potential Downtime)
  • First, copy/export all existing DNS records from Cloudflare.
  • Switch the nameservers to VentraIP (this is required before you can add records there).
  • As soon as the switch completes, manually re-add all the records into VentraIP.
  • There may be a short window of downtime between the nameserver change and the records being added back in.

We’ve also noticed there are a lot of DNS records — over 700+ at the moment. It’s completely up to you whether you’d like to clean these up before moving, as some may no longer be in use. Keeping only the active/necessary ones will make things easier to manage moving forward.

If zero downtime is a priority, Option 1 (staying on Cloudflare) is the safest. If you prefer everything consolidated in VentraIP, Option 2 works too — it just requires careful timing when re-adding the records.

Let us know if this works for you.

action.text: Victoria Victoria assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hello,

Thanks for the explanation, it helps a lot

I can't create DNS records in VentraIP. The problem is before I create any DNS record, VentraIP force me to change the Nameserver from cloudflare to VentraIP

I guess firstI will copy all existing DNS records from cloudflare then only create in VentraIP.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Victoria Victoria

full_threads.body:
Hi Jatin,

Thanks for the follow-up.

We'd suggest not changing the nameservers to VentraIP just yet - unless you already have a full copy of all the existing DNS records, as changing them without that may cause disruptions.

We'll send you an invite shortly to access the Cloudflare account, so you can either manage the DNS records directly from there or copy them over as needed.

Once you've reviewed everything and safely added the records to VentraIP, you're welcome to go ahead and move the nameservers if required.

Otherwise, feel free to continue managing everything through Cloudflare.

Let us know if you have any questions in the meantime.

Thanks,
Wolf IQ Accounts Team
1300 072 134
accounts@wolfiq.com.au
